WorkItem.ClosedComment: This issue has been open for 30+ days without response. If this is still an issue, please resubmit with current files and references to the versions affected.
WorkItem.Description:
I'm getting error messages when I try to load characters from the Armory.
 
Step Name: Get Character
Description: Rawr encountered an error retrieving the Character - Endoreefer@US-Dragonmaw from the armory
The 'div' start tag on line 122 does not match the end tag of 'p'. Line 137, position 10.
   at Rawr.WebRequestWrapper.DownloadXml(String URI, Boolean allowTable)
   at Rawr.WebRequestWrapper.DownloadCharacterSheet(String characterName, CharacterRegion region, String realm)
   at Rawr.Armory.GetCharacter(CharacterRegion region, String realm, String name, String[]& itemsOnCharacter)
 
Step Name: Get Character
Description: Rawr encountered an error retrieving the Character - Tribat@US-Dragonmaw from the armory
The 'div' start tag on line 122 does not match the end tag of 'p'. Line 137, position 10.
   at Rawr.WebRequestWrapper.DownloadXml(String URI, Boolean allowTable)
   at Rawr.WebRequestWrapper.DownloadCharacterSheet(String characterName, CharacterRegion region, String realm)
   at Rawr.Armory.GetCharacter(CharacterRegion region, String realm, String name, String[]& itemsOnCharacter)
WorkItem.Summary: Error when loading characters from Armory

Comments.Message: I am unable to reproduce this error. I can load those two characters from the Armory just fine with 2.2.12. Try deleting your current copy of Rawr, and downloading/extracting a fresh version of 2.2.12. If that still doesn't work, is there anymore information you can give about the situation?

I've tried redownloading, running as admin with and w/o compatibility for Vista on (I have windows 7 RC 7100). But the same thing. It appears to be a global error as I have tried various characters from around the world to no avail.
Sounds like you have some sort of web-based internet protection, like when you connect to a public wifi connection, and have to login/pay/whatever in a web page.
